name: United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America, by Sabol, trustee, v. Local 227, United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America et al., Appellants
name_abbreviation: United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum & Plastic Workers of America v. Local 227, United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum & Plastic Workers of America

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
parties: United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America, by Sabol, trustee, v. Local 227, United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
After a careful study of the record in this case, we are convinced that under controlling decisions the decree of the court below must be affirmed.
It is so ordered. Costs to be paid by the appellee.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Richard II. Markowitz, with him Samuel Rothbard and Abraham L. Friedman, of the New Jersey Bar, and Wilderman, Markowitz <& Kirschner, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America, by Sabol, trustee, v. Local 227, United Rubber, Cork, Linoleum and Plastic Workers of America et al., Appellants.
Argued May 6, 1969.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Walter Phipps, Jr., for appellant.
Richard II. Markowitz, with him Samuel Rothbard and Abraham L. Friedman, of the New Jersey Bar, and Wilderman, Markowitz <& Kirschner, for appellee.
October 9, 1969:
